pullRequest.body:
This PR is separated off from #12273, which no longer depends on it. 

We show that an order with a strictly monotone function into an order with WellFoundedLT is itself WellFoundedLT. 
We also add three dual variants, and provide an instance showing that a Nat-graded order is thus well-founded. 

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

#### Import changes for modified files

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ GradeOrder.wellFoundedGT`
`+ GradeOrder.wellFoundedLT`
`+ StrictAnti.wellFoundedGT`
`+ StrictAnti.wellFoundedLT`
`+ StrictMono.wellFoundedGT`
`+ StrictMono.wellFoundedLT`
`+ instance [GradeOrder ℕ α] : WellFoundedLT α`
`+ instance [GradeOrder ℕᵒᵈ α] : WellFoundedGT α`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>
Mathematically this is not my expertise, but in terms of style I think this looks good to me!

Looks fine other than the comment above.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9995436002/job/27627562803)

I would actually name this differently to unlock dot notation. Same for the others in this file.
```suggestion
theorem StrictMono.wellFoundedLT [WellFoundedLT β] (hf : StrictMono f) : WellFoundedLT α where
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/WellFounded): well-founded of strictly monotone
